pull.title: docs: Clarify commit message guidelines
pull.body: In this small PR, the gist of [this helpful and informative comment from @fanquake](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14583#issuecomment-433668211) is added to the official contributing instructions, to help future first-time contributors get their commit messages right.

events.body: "any @ mentions should be removed" isn't specific to the squashing commits section. There shouldn't be @ mentions in any commit messages at all.
@jnewbery Thanks. Do you know if this is mentioned anywhere in the bitcoin repo?
I don't know. It should be in CONTRIBUTING.md if it's anywhere.
@jnewbery I updated the commit after your suggestion, please have another look.

rename.from: docs: Add instructions about commit message when squashing

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -135,6 +137,9 @@ before it will be merged. The basic squashing workflow is shown below.
     # Save and quit.
     git push -f # (force push to GitHub)
 
+The commit message should be updated so that it doesn't include all the
+messages from the interim commits.
comments.body: IMO, this requirement is not suitable for all cases.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -135,6 +137,9 @@ before it will be merged. The basic squashing workflow is shown below.
     # Save and quit.
     git push -f # (force push to GitHub)
 
+The commit message should be updated so that it doesn't include all the
+messages from the interim commits.
comments.body:
Interesting! Would you (or someone else) care to elaborate? 
Personally I don't really know, but it seems like something that would benefit from a set guideline.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -135,6 +137,9 @@ before it will be merged. The basic squashing workflow is shown below.
     # Save and quit.
     git push -f # (force push to GitHub)
 
+The commit message should be updated so that it doesn't include all the
+messages from the interim commits.
comments.body:
e.g., 869193f5a6398bb9e4a6f4a7aeb8d2203193c80f
That commit was squashed from two ones. And its message _does_ include all the messages from the squashed commits.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -135,6 +137,9 @@ before it will be merged. The basic squashing workflow is shown below.
     # Save and quit.
     git push -f # (force push to GitHub)
 
+The commit message should be updated so that it doesn't include all the
+messages from the interim commits.
comments.body:
I think I see what you are saying; there can be cases where just listing the interim commits happens to form a coherent message. 

New suggestion:
`Please update the resulting commit message if needed, it should read as a coherent message. In most cases this means that you should not just list the interim commits.`

comments.diff_hunk:

     git push -f # (force push to GitHub)
 
+The commit message should be updated so that it doesn't include all the
+messages from the interim commits.
